title: 1980s fonts
content:
Greetings all. A friend of mine is working on a design project meant to bring to mind the 1980s, and has asked me for some font recommendations. He recognizes an '80s font when he sees one, but he can't remember font names to save his life. When I think of '80s typography, the first thing that comes to mind is Remedy. Arquitectura and Lithos, though technically '90s fonts, also make me think of the Reagan administration. Does anyone have any recommendations I can pass on? He'd really appreciate it.

AHL
author: ahleman

Kind of depends on the context, but here are some I recall being popular (some more unique to the Eighties than others):

Van Dijk  
ITC Garamond  
Univers Condensed  
Onyx  
The LaserWriter 35  
Century Old Style  
ITC Franklin  
Crillee  
Bernhard Modern  
Benguiat  
Enviro  
Transmission  
Scanner  
Frankfurter  
Freestyle Script  
Radiant  
Corvinus Skyline  
Neville Brody's Adobe fonts  
Early Emigre fonts  
Bodoni  
Early Adobe release (ITC Baskerville, Futura, Trump Medaeval, etc.)  
ITC Fenice  
Palatino  
Goudy Old Style
Futura Extra Bold Condensed, tightly spaced.

@SuperUltraFabulous: Sinaloa & Stop

Hmm. Those seem more Seventies to me.

You can also use '1980s' in the search window at sites like MyFonts and FontShop. Some results seem questionable (at first glance), but many are correct, even if some typefaces were renamed to avoid revival copyright issues.

Another place to look would be the ever-popular Phil's Photo book "Homage to the Alphabet" from 1985. Those are film types, but many have been digitized.

- Mike Yanega
